Key Match Events: Jeremy Peña hit a three-run homer to right-center field in the sixth inning, putting Houston up 10-4.
Chas McCormick hit a clutch two-run single with the bases loaded in Houston’s four-run fourth inning.
Yusei Kikuchi threw 99 pitches (67 strikes) in six innings, allowing four runs on seven hits, including two homers, while striking out six batters.
Post-Match Reflections: Astros manager Joe Espada praised the team's offensive approach, highlighting the importance of hitting the ball up the middle and the other way.
Chas McCormick reflected on his performance and the opportunity to contribute after being recalled from Triple-A.
Joe Espada expressed confidence in McCormick's potential and the importance of giving him opportunities.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros improved to 7-0 in games started by Yusei Kikuchi, who was acquired from the Blue Jays at the Trade Deadline.
Every Astros starter either had a hit or scored a run, contributing to Houston's sixth consecutive win at Minute Maid Park.
